main event: On 12 May 1949, two fuzzy star-like objects were observed over Holloman AFB in New Mexico.
interesting points: The observer, Dr. Menzel from Harvard, noted the objects appeared white with a greenish tinge and were shaped like fuzzy stars., The objects were stationary and visible for approximately 4 minutes., The observer calculated that the objects were at least 120 miles away., The incident occurred while the observer was watching the moon rise., The report describes the phenomenon as puzzling with no satisfactory theory available.
witness description: Dr. Menzel, an observer from Harvard.
